snippet: The investigation into illegal conduct at Barclays points to similar acts by other big banks.
abstract: Editorial asserts that the investigation into Barclays over charges of rigging benchmark interest rates points to similar acts by other banks; holds that the Justice Department has not distinguished itself in prosecuting major banks or their executives for illegal conduct, but with Barclays cooperating, this case is another chance for government prosecutors to unmask and punish financial wrongdoing.
lead_paragraph: The investigation into illegal conduct at Barclays points to similar acts by other big banks.
